backgroundTasks
Class CountReadsInBAM

java.lang.Object
  backgroundTasks.CountReadsInBAM
All Implemented Interfaces:
Runnable
public class CountReadsInBAM
extends Object
implements Runnable

CountReadsInBam is a class that counts the number of reads in a BAM file. It takes in two SAMFileReaders because iterating through a BAM can take a while and cannot be interupted. Instead, the program counts a clone which increases responsivness while users use other features. When it completes counting, it updates a JPanel and puts the count in a HashMap, specified by the programer.

Author:
Vincent Xue

Instantiates a thread to count the BAM file

Parameters:
input - the original SAMFileReader
iClone - the cloneFileReader
iName - the name of the Sample
iParent - the parent JSpliceViewGui that called it. (This is to get the RPKM function)
bamFileCountHash - the hash that contains the count of the file.
iPanelToUpdate - the Jpanel to update the count
